conclusion: Understand the relationship between magnetic field, speed of rod, and induced EMF when rod is bent.
Understand initial setup: uniform magnetic field, rod moving perpendicular to magnetic field and induction intensity at speed v.
Calculate induced EMF at start: \( \varepsilon = BvL \).
Rod is bent into two equal-length and mutually perpendicular segments, length becomes \( 2L \), speed remains \( v \).
Calculate induced EMF at end of bent rod: \( \varepsilon' = Bv \times 2L = 2BLv \).
